term.title: meso structures

item.text: Relative configurations of consecutive, but not necessarily contiguous, constitutionally equivalent carbon atoms that have a symmetrically-constituted connecting group (if any) are designated 'meso' or 'racemo', as appropriate. Examples: [image: Not defined] (The symbol [image: Not defined] represents a symmetrically-constituted connecting group, such as –CH2–, –CH2–CH2–, or –CR2–CH2–CR2–.)
